p: Only four chemical components were in common among all three species, namely nerol, spathulenol, caryophyllene oxide, and humulene epoxide. These accounted for 30.15%, 15.65%, and 28.43% of the total peak area in SO, SG, and SP essential oils, respectively ( Figure 2). The essential oils of SO and SG shared 5 chemical components, as did the essential oils of SO and SP ( Figure 2). SG and SP shared eleven identical components, as shown in Figure 2.
